trend: U.S. Drug Price Reform Targets Global Pharma Giants
summary: President Trump signed an executive order to reduce prescription drug prices in the U.S., warning pharmaceutical companies against price gouging and setting a 30-day deadline for proposed price reductions, with threats of further action within six months.
source title: GSK and AstraZeneca take hit as Trump vows to make drugs cheaper

summary: U.S. health spending increased by 7.5% in 2023 to $4.9 trillion, driven by higher utilization of healthcare goods and a historically high insured share of 92.5%.
The healthcare industry faces sustainability challenges due to increased use of disposable medical products during the Covid-19 pandemic, especially PPE.
Healthcare is transforming with AI, personalized medicine, and digital health platforms improving diagnostics, treatments, and patient engagement.
source title: The 10 Biggest Trends Revolutionizing Healthcare In 2024

trend: Global Health Systems Prioritize Operational Efficiency
summary: More than 70% of C-suite health leaders are prioritizing operational efficiency and productivity to improve patient engagement and outcomes in 2025.

trend: Global Regulators Prioritize Climate Risk Assessment
summary: Banking regulators are prioritizing assessment of climate-related financial risks, aligning with international strategies to mitigate environmental impacts.
source title: Global banking regulators agree to prioritise climate risk work

summary: Global debt hit $324 trillion in Q1 2025, driven by spending in China, France, and Germany, raising concerns about economic resilience.
source title: Global debt hits record over $324 trillion, says IIF

trend: New Zealand Central Bank Warns of Financial System Risks
summary: New Zealand's central bank warns of rising risks to the financial system due to global volatility and U.S. tariff impacts.
source title: New Zealand central bank warns of financial system risks amid global volatility

summary: Companies downplay ESG initiatives publicly amid political backlash while continuing sustainability practices internally—a trend called 'greenhushing'.
source title: The rise of greenhushing: Embrace ESG but don’t talk about it

summary: Fintech continues reshaping finance through technology-driven services, expanding digital product access and disrupting traditional banking.

trend: AI Integration in Banking Enhances Client Services
summary: Generative AI is transforming banking through more personalized services, optimized operations, and innovative product development.
source title: The Top 10 Banking Trends For 2024 — The Age Of AI

summary: Global banks push back against post-crisis regulations, as memories of 2008 fade and competition from private finance increases.
source title: Global banks are nearing peak regulation

summary: Banking is shifting from relationship-driven to transactional, with digital experiences driving customers to multi-bank engagement.
source title: Banking Consumer Study: Advocacy and Growth

trend: Banking Industry Faces Cost Management Pressures
summary: European banks brace for cost growth outpacing revenues in 2024, prompting new efficiency initiatives.

trend: Global Banking Industry Achieves Record Profits
summary: Banks globally reached $7 trillion in revenue and $1.1 trillion net income in 2024, with strong returns and capital positions.
